items.title: What you should know about the owners of US TikTok
items.summary: ​ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese parent company, recently established a separate American entity to run the app’s U.S. operations. This restructuring aims to separate U.S. TikTok from its Chinese parent, addressing concerns about data privacy and foreign control. The move came after years of pressure from lawmakers, who feared the Chinese government’s potential access to Americans’ data. […]

items.title: WhatsApp To Roll Out Strict Account Settings Globally
items.summary:
In addition to end-to-end encryption, WhatsApp is adding another layer of security called Strict Account Settings. The company claims that this added feature can allegedly protect users’ accounts from “highly sophisticated” cyberattacks. In most cases, when a user isn’t under attack, this security function blocks attachments and media from unknown senders, disables link previews, and […]

items.title: Pick up Anker’s SOLIX F3000 3,072Wh power station at its $1,199 low + get 120V generator and EV charger adapter cables
items.summary:
As part of Anker’s extended SOLIX Winter Sale, we noticed the F3000 Portable Power Station with 120V generator and EV charger adapter cables down at $1,199 shipped, which isn’t an available bundle at Amazon, but does beat the standalone power station’s sale pricing by $100. While the power station on its own carries a $2,599 MSRP and can usually be found starting for around $1,600 at Amazon, this newer bundle sits with a higher $2,797 starting rate, which we saw go as low as $1,199 in the first iteration of this sale, when the power station was also at the same price, which happens to be the standalone all-time low. Now, despite the station sitting $100 higher, you can still technically score it at its lowest tracked price while gaining the additional adapter cables, making this all the better of a deal, as they allow for connections to any gas generator or EV charger you may already own. We’ve also rounded up some additional bundles for this series below.

more…

Now, you’re getting the first official price cuts of 2026 with these savings, returning the prices to the lowest we have tracked. items.title: Get 2-in-1 long-reaching functionality with Greenworks’ 24V cordless polesaw + pole hedge trimmer combo at $202
items.summary:
Update 1/27: Amazon has dropped the price further on this 2-in-1 combo kit to its second-lowest price of $201.69 shipped, landing it just $2 above the all-time low.

Amazon is currently offering the Greenworks 24V 10-inch Cordless Polesaw + 20-inch Pole Hedge Trimmer Combo with 4.0Ah battery at $212.67 shipped, beating out its direct website pricing by $87. This combo kit usually goes for a $300 MSRP direct from the brand, however, at Amazon, we’ve been seeing it start lower between $261 and $251 since August, with discounts having gone as low as $200, last seen during the first week of November. You’re looking at a $48 markdown from the highest of the more recent going rates ($87 off the MSRP), landing it at the third-best price we have tracked, which is only $13 above the low and $3 above the second-lowest price.

items.title: Tested: RayNeo X3 Pro glasses give a glimpse of AR in 2026 with a lot of compromises for the price
items.summary:
Today’s smart glasses generally fall into two camps: ones that put a big, wearable display in front of your eyes purely for entertainment, gaming, and media like Viture’s Lumar Ultra, and there are others like the RayNeo X3 Pro we’re checking out today – that aim to deliver practical, everyday AR experiences. I’m already a heavy user of the first kind for daily entertainment, but I’ve yet to see anything truly compelling in the “real” AR space for day-to-day use. I’ve been using the RayNeo X3 Pro as my primary pair of glasses for the past few weeks, and they offer a glimpse into where AR is in 2026 – full of potential, but still weighed down by deal-breaking compromises. Head below for a closer look and my full experience.

more…

items.title: Razer’s Phantom White Barracuda X Chroma RGB wireless headset hits one of its lowest prices at $101
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Razer’s latest Phantom White Barracuda X Chroma RGB wireless gaming mouse down to $101.20 shipped. This is a new addition to the Barracuda X Chroma lineup that recently hit the scene alongside other Phantom White accessories carrying a $140 price tag. This model saw its first discount earlier this month when it hit $120, but today’s deal shaves an additional $19 off to mark one of the lowest prices we have tracked for it to date. It briefly dropped below $100 earlier today, but is now hovering at the $101 mark with a 28% discount. You can also get this in black and white finishes, although they’re both fetching $120 with a relatively lighter discount. Head below for more details.

items.title: The price gap between Waymo and Uber is narrowing
items.summary: A trip in a Waymo robotaxi still costs more, on average, than a comparable ride in a human-driven Uber or a Lyft. But that gap is narrowing, according to new data published Tuesday by Obi, a company that aggregates real-time pricing and pickup times across multiple ride-hailing services.
